Key.English: Vehicle will be automatically registered as available artillery for dynamic strikes
This location is targeted by the first available artillery unit of a given side. The artillery unit must be registered to the side and be within striking distance
Which side is calling for artillery
Number of rounds in the main salvo
Default dispersion of the main salvo
Check this to disable initial rounds used by the fire controller to adjust rounds on target.\nSkipping this will make the barrage immediately hit on target
Register units to that sides artillery pool.
Units have been added to Artillery Pool
No Units have been added to Artillery Pool
Task Assault/Retreat is a multi-purpose module. It makes linked unit rush or retreat madly towards the module destination. The module can be moved to dynamically alter the final destination.
Enable this to make the unit retreat and ignore enemies
Deletes module on startup.\nIf unchecked it is possible to move the module to change destination dynamically
Units within this many meters will revert to regular behavior
The cycle time of the script

Task Camp makes the unit appear to gather around a single point, typically a campsite. Some units will peel off to man static weapons, garrison buildings and patrol the area.
Set area in 3DEN.
Radius buildings and static weapons are garrisoned and manned\nTwice this number is used for patrols
The cycle time for the script in seconds. Higher numbers make units search buildings more carefully.\nDefault 21 seconds
With the dynamic center present, it is possible to move the center point of the building search pattern
Max distance houses will be searched

Task CQB makes the unit search buildings with the area. Set the module size in 3DEN to configure the search area. The module can be moved to dynamically shift the searched area.

In general the module works best with a smaller AOE. Better to string multiple modules or waypoints together than have one massive one. Groups of the same side will share which buildings have been cleared and which still need searching.
Task Garrison makes the unit take up positions in buildings and man available turrets and static weapons within an area defined by 3DEN attributes.
The unit will generate a new patrol pattern once one patrol cycle is complete
Task Patrol makes the unit patrol within the area set by 3DEN attributes.
This module resets all custom LAMBS scripts running on the unit
The creeping group will use the group leader as a center for the search pattern. Disable to have the unit use the module position instead. This creates a more defensive group
The cycle time for the script in seconds. Higher numbers can be used to make the creeping group less accurate.\nDefault 15 seconds
Distance creeping group will search for enemies.\nThis module only targets enemy players

Task Creep makes the unit attempt to ambush enemies within the area set by 3DEN attributes. The group will use available cover and keep a low stance to remain undiscovered.

Search modules only target hostile players

Task Hunt makes the unit patrol the area within the area set by 3DEN attributes. The group will move casually in a search pattern gradually spiraling closer to the target. The unit will enable flashlights if available.

Search modules only target hostile players.
The hunting group will use the group leader as a center for the search pattern. Disable to have the unit use the module position instead. This creates a more defensive group
The cycle time for the script in seconds. Higher numbers can be used to make the hunting group less accurate.\nDefault 70 seconds
Distance hunting group will search for enemies.\nThis module only targets enemy players

Task Rush makes the unit attempt to run aggressively towards enemies within the area set by 3DEN attributes. The unit will move extremely aggressively, often ignoring cover and suppression.

Search modules only target hostile players. Disable unit FSM for a truly terrifying enemy.
The rushing group will use the group leader as a center for the search pattern. Disable to have the unit use the module position instead. This creates a more defensive group
The cycle time for the script in seconds. Higher numbers can be used to make rushers less accurate.\nDefault 4 seconds
Distance rushing group will search for enemies.\nThis module only targets enemy players
Automatically adds artillery already present in the mission to Side
Select which unit script applies to.\nList is sorted by distance
Sets center for the script execution. This can be self or a LAMBS Dynamic Target selected from the list
